tweet: Bitcoin Cash supporters believe Bitcoin has been corrupted by Blockstream and others. What’s your point?

I have to ask one last question: I just put out a tweet storm meant to be in good spirits and asking everyone just to be respectful. Why is one of the first replies from a Core Developer who instantly uses a term that Bitcoin Cash supporters find derogatory?

Because BCash hasn’t launched yet : https://medium.com/@freetrade68/announcing-bcash-8b938329eaeb?source=linkShare-220c1c547a96-1514145674 … And in terms of Bitcoin Cash vs Litecoin - the market cap is significantly bigger with more liquidity.

Both are children of the genesis block and Bitcoin Cash has sufficient liquidity and market cap that it cannot be ignored. That said, if you think the other is scam, then just ignore it - what’s the point of fighting, the truth will out in the end.

Bottom line, let’s just move on and stop fighting. Focus on whichever philosophy you feel most strongly aligned too. Bitcoin Cash should use the green logo and Bitcoin should keep the orange logo. Hard to confuse them and I think it’s becoming very clear which is which.

If you’re long on Bitcoin itself as a technology, you should own both in a ratio of 1 BTC : 1 BCH to avoid risk of either side winning/losing, if you favor BCH, hold maybe 2-3+ BCH for every BTC you own, if you favor BTC religiously, then dump your BCH but remember you bear risk.

I’m also going to stop calling out hypocrisy in either camp and focus on the positives going into 2018. We have two experiments running - Bitcoin Cash & Bitcoin Core - let’s see who wins in a year’s time.

Bitcoin Cash can focus on their vision and Bitcoin can continue along their path. If you feel disenchanted by one camp, switch to the other. If you hate both, move to an alt coin - but let’s just stop the bickering.

If you want fast, cheap payments, use Bitcoin Cash. If you want to buy into the Store of Value theory for Bitcoin, then buy and hold it. Mudslinging back and forth between both camps is a waste of time.
Bitcoin was created to disrupt many things, but which one was the PRIMARY intended target, as per the original white paper:
